control

Class GamePlayController

  • java.lang.Object
    • control.FXController
      • control.GamePlayController

  • public class GamePlayController
extends FXController
    Main game play controller. It's the most difficult. Here're all game logic.
    Since:
    v. 1.0
    Author:
    Dmitriy Meleshko

      This enum is used in GamePlayController.FieldDrawAnimation, there're states/"frames"/points of pointer spawn animation.

        Size of one cell. It's quite important constant, it's used when controller redraws game field.

      • movingPointer

        private boolean movingPointer
        This' variables name says about himself. It's used to make game pointer move just in one direction on one keypress.

        private javafx.scene.canvas.Canvas gameCanvas
        Game canvas from .fxml file.

      • graphics

        private javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext graphics
        Link to gameCanvas' graphics. Just for time economy.

      • undoStack

        private LIFOQueue<java.lang.String> undoStack
        Undo stack for moves. When you press Ctrl+Z - this code runs: 
        
 if (movingPointer) return;

 String move = undoStack.pop();

 if (move == null) return;
 redoStack.push(move);

 if (movingPointer) return;

 pointerMoveAnimation = new PointerMoveAnimation(invertMove(move));
 pointerMoveAnimation.start();
        Where invertMove(String) is function, that inverts direction of move by this schema: 
        
 A <----> D
 W <----> S
        As you can see - Strings are moves/key chars.

        Note: this stack appends when you move.

      • redoStack

        private LIFOQueue<java.lang.String> redoStack
        Undo stack for moves. When you press Ctrl+R - this code runs: 
        
 if (movingPointer) return;

 String move = redoStack.pop();

 if (move == null) return;
 undoStack.push(move);


 pointerMoveAnimation = new PointerMoveAnimation(move);
 pointerMoveAnimation.start();
        Where invertMove(String) is function, that inverts direction of move by this schema: 
        
 A <----> D
 W <----> S
        As you can see - Strings are moves/key chars.

        private final javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent> GP_MOVE_EVENT_HANDLER

      • delay

        private void delay(long howLong)
        Safe wrapper for Thread.sleep(long).
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if catches InterruptedException, and sets cause to caught InterruptedException.

      • init

        public void init()
        Description copied from class: FXController
        Alternative for method initialize in standard JavaFX controllers. But, there's a difference. When Main.changeScene(String, String) changes scene - this method activates.
        Specified by:
        init in class FXController

      • drawFinish

        private void drawFinish(int x,
                        int y)
        Draws finish cell. Finish is 4x4 grid in cell. And, for drawing finish columns as normal, I use variable fillColumnShift. When loop for y axis starts, variable fillBlack sets to shift variable. When this loop ends, fillColumnShift inverts.
        Parameters:
        x - x of cell
        y - y of cell

      • drawTriangle

        private void drawTriangle(double x1,
                          double y1,
                          double x2,
                          double y2,
                          double x3,
                          double y3)
        Draws triangle. It's wrapper for such code: 
        
 graphics.fillPolygon(new double[] {x1, x2, x3}, new double[] {y1, y2, y3}, 3);
 graphics.strokePolygon(new double[] {x1, x2, x3}, new double[] {y1, y2, y3}, 3);
        Well, it's quite long construction. This method makes this code much smaller: 
        
 drawTriangle(x1, y1, x2, y2, x3, y3);
        Looks smaller, isn't it?
        Parameters:
        x1 - first x coordinate
        y1 - first y coordinate
        x2 - second x coordinate
        y2 - second y coordinate
        x3 - third x coordinate
        y3 - third y coordinate

      • redrawFieldCell

        private void redrawFieldCell(int x,
                             int y)
        Redraws one cell on field.

        Starting cell is peculiar (see LevelCell.CellType.START to read how it looks). To draw triangle on the start in use this scheme:

        1. Using some value in range 0.0 - 100.0 for current point (start - x1)
        2. Mapping this value to range 0.0 - 45.0
        3. Giving received value to method that draws triangle
        4. Repeating this 5 times with y1, x2, y2, x3 and y3

        Parameters:
        x - x position of cell. Note: it's position in collection, not in canvas.
        y - y position of cell. Note: it's position in collection, not in canvas.

      • redrawField
